website_summaries.verdict: The best budget option for a Thunderbolt 3 docking and charging station.
pros: Single monitor output will run a 4K video output
The body of the docking station is small enough to fit on crowded surface spaces
cons: The body of the docking station is large, taking up more space than comparable options

customer_reviews.title: Constant disconnections from the MacBook Pro made this thing unusable
customer_reviews.text: Continuously disconnected from my MacBook Pro while it was asleep. I'd raise the lid on the computer only to see multiple notifications that the external hard drive became disconnected without being unmounted. Every time it'd wake up to check mail, a new notification would get generated. I sent it back. Very discouraged by the current stater of USB-C docks. It's not just Plugable, it's other docks I've tried as well. I've resorted to the HDMI adapter, a USB hub, and a spare charger. It's an unsightly combination and it was more expensive than this, but it's doing the job with a single plug.
customer_reviews.author: Mister B

customer_reviews.title: Excellent Brick
customer_reviews.text: This is a really excellent brick. It doesn't connect to anything, you can layer it with concrete, and it can send you down a whirlpool of USB C remorse when you consider the false promises. It's also the first brick I've purchased that has the ability to make your attempt at doing work *more* complicated. Strange for a brick. My only complaint is this brick isn't red? I'm not sure why they chose black metal for the color of this brick. But, fortunately this brick is much lighter than those other ones. It has these ports thingies; that's cute. They don't do anything, which makes this a really funny brick. Silly brick.
customer_reviews.author: Joseph Kent

customer_reviews.title: Great little Thunderbolt 3 dock.
customer_reviews.text: I love this little dock. It is the thing that ties my whole setup together. It allows me to easily use my Dell XPS 13 (9360 with 8th gen i5 processor) with an ultrawide monitor, mechanical keyboard, mouse, and wired internet connection to get a lot of stuff done when at home. And then when I want to take my laptop on the road I just disconnect it from the dock and I have a fully charged laptop ready to go.
customer_reviews.author: Quincy Band

customer_reviews.title: Good quality, and outstanding tech-support!
customer_reviews.text: The dock and accessory equipment are well built, easy to setup and unlike some other USB-C/Thunderbolt docks I tried, it worked without any hassle. The best part was exceptional customer service in response to an error in one of the specification documents. Plugable responded to a complex problem within a few hours, immediately offered a solution that was 100% satisfactory, and fixed the error in an online document. Anyone considering one of these new (and expensive!) USB-C/Thunderbolt docks should be aware of how buggy and difficult this new interface is to apply. Plugable is the best option. Note - I also learned to make sure so choose sufficient power-supply wattage, some laptops, wow - power hungry.
customer_reviews.author: A. Westwood

customer_reviews.title: Works with HP Spectre laptop
customer_reviews.text: I have been using this for 5 months with only one issue. After a power outage the docking station seemed to have issues and I had to power cycle it to get it to work correctly again. I have an HP Spectre Laptop and use the docking station to connect to an LG 34 inches Full HD IPS LED Monitor and Logitech wireless keyboard and mouse. I have had no issues with the connection to any of these devices. I do think it is priced high for what it is but the competing products seem to be priced even higher. Overall I am very satisfied with the purchase.
customer_reviews.author: booklover

customer_reviews.title: The ONLY solution for the Macbook Pro 15"
customer_reviews.text: I literally tried about 7 different docking stations and dongles so that I could get the 1 plug for everything solution with my Macbook. But because the 15" needs 87w of power to charge it, nothing was giving me enough to accomplish that while also handling HDMI and USB ports. This one does 85w and for the past several months it has been rock solid for me with no issues. I'm docking it 1 star because the power button in the front of the box is way too easy to push by accident and pretty unnecessary. I'd only knock it 1/2 a star if I could though
customer_reviews.author: Jared M.

customer_reviews.title: Works well with Chromebook Google Pixelbook M3
customer_reviews.text: Bought for work and personal home use. I put Chromebook in the headline to help others; most people use this dock with Windows and macOS and it's hard to find info online about what docks work with the newest hardware and software. The first one shipped defective; external 27" HD monitor had jitter; did troubleshooting to ensure the dock was the problem. Amazon exchanged and shipped replacement quickly. No jitter this time. I have an amp and DAC hooked up as well. No problems. Cleans up the desk considerably. Recommended.
customer_reviews.author: Just a Guy

customer_reviews.title: Great docking station for HP Spectre!
customer_reviews.text: This docking station works great with my new HP Spectre x360 - 15t. I emailed Plugable before buying to see what docking station they would recommend. They got back to me very quickly and recommended this one. Plugable's customer support is terrific! Very happy with this docking station.
customer_reviews.author: Kim

customer_reviews.title: Perfect usage with new MacBook Pro
customer_reviews.text: This is probably the best docking port for the MacBook Pro. It has substantially cleaned up the wiring to my devices and the computer. Biggest thing is that it powers itself and all the connected devices including the MacBook. I have a wireless keyboard and mouse, wired network, monitor via HDMI, and an external hard drive off this device. Then simply plug in the single USB-C cord from the device to the MacBook and all are working great! I've tried others that were a little bit less expensive, but it is worth the little extra money to get this device.
customer_reviews.author: C. Grimm

customer_reviews.title: Works on 2018 15" MacBook Pro!!
customer_reviews.text: I tried a number of different USB-C hubs\docking stations with 2018 MacBook pro, all had same issue - when macbook went to sleep, monitor connected via dock would not turn back up until unplugging USB-C and\or unplugging power from dock. This is the first and only dock I found that does not have this problem. Been using for over a month with no problems. USB 3.0 and front audio\mic port works on High Sierra. Small and compact, comes with mount for mount on back of monitor. Wish it had SD\MicroSD card reader, but otherwise a great dock.
customer_reviews.author: Shivang Patel

customer_reviews.title: Works well with my Dell laptop
customer_reviews.text: I bought this device for use with my Dell XPS 7590 laptop. It works well. It has all the ports that I need. A minor issue is that Windows 10 displays a caution icon that the hub is not providing as much power as the charger that comes with laptop. I am charging using the thunderbolt port. This hub provides 85 W. while the laptop comes with a 130 W. charger. However, the laptop still charges to 100% using this hub and remains at that level.
customer_reviews.author: Stephen

customer_reviews.title: Dock had a few issues but Plugable customer support made up for it in full.
customer_reviews.text: This dock works great for turning a USB type C enabled laptop into a desktop-like experience. I had some minor issues where the dock would fail to recognize the display I had plugged in if I let the computer go to sleep and stay asleep for like 2+ hours. I think it was an issue on the MacOS side of things. I asked Plugable customer support for a refund and bought their Thunderbolt 3 dock and so far I've not had any issues with that one (I guess the Thunderbolt 3 protocols are more solid for MacOS?).
customer_reviews.author: Mophab

customer_reviews.title: Works well with Lenovo Yoga 920
customer_reviews.text: Compact dock that includes 85W power supply that should be sufficient for even the most power hungry laptops. Easily provides enough power for my Lenovo Yoga 920. I've connect various USB 3.0 devices to it including a camera, and external hard drives with no issues. Works with my 4K HDMI monitor. No display port output but that's ok.
customer_reviews.author: AZMark

customer_reviews.title: Do not buy this unit.
customer_reviews.text: After three months the unit started to drop disk connections and then stopped charging my MacBook Pro. I’ve been in contact with customer service three times. The first time they asked for the serial number and shipping address to send me a new one. I sent both and never heard a thing. I’ve emailed them three more times and have heard nothing. Do not purchase this unit. It will fail and you’ll be hung out to dry.
customer_reviews.author: Christopher B.

customer_reviews.title: Excellent product that works with Samsung Notebook 9 Pro
customer_reviews.text: Worked out of the box. Charges the laptop and provides a great external display signal. The only thing I would nitpick about it is it is on the light side. It gets pulled around very easily unless you balance it perfectly with all the cables sticking out the back and don't ever tug it like say with any headphones that you've permanently attached. It has rubber feet which help somewhat, but it should have weights inside like the Surface Dock.
customer_reviews.author: Roger M. Levy

customer_reviews.title: Ethernet Port Dead
customer_reviews.text: Most of it works fine. The bummer is that the ethernet port stopped functioning recently. I know it is this unit that is defective because I tried it with a different ethernet to USB C converter and that worked. Now I'm questioning the quality of this device.
customer_reviews.author: J

customer_reviews.title: Limited Ability
customer_reviews.text: I bought this as a dock for my laptop. The USB, ethernet, and power delivery works well but not as described. My computer reports the charging Wattage to be around 65W and with a better thunderbolt cable that it came with (Even though the description mentioned 85W). The HDMI port works but will make your monitor glitch out when displaying HD videos or playing video games. I would only recommend this for those with weak computers or aren't concerned with performance.
customer_reviews.author: Gerry

customer_reviews.title: Simple setup that works great with 2018 Dell and MacBook Pro laptops
customer_reviews.text: After a long search for an easy "plug in and out" docking station, this seems to be the winner. It not only provides output to my 32-inch display (single monitor only), network connection and ample speedy USB ports, it supplies the necessary power to my Dell laptop and Macbook Pro (both 2018). Once set up correctly, all I have to do is plug in the USB-C cable and I'm good to go. I like this product so much, I own three of them.
customer_reviews.author: Spec

customer_reviews.title: Works Well
customer_reviews.text: Works great with my Dell laptop. I do periodically run into issues where the HDMI does not send signal and I have to unplug and replug the HDMI. Additionally, sometimes the laptop does not power up when connecting the USB C cable. Overall plenty of ports and when everything is up and running it works great.
customer_reviews.author: D. McQuestion

customer_reviews.title: Problems connecting to MacBook pro
customer_reviews.text: I love the idea, form factor, features and the company. But, i need to unplug and plug in most mornings to get it to sync with my Mac and dell monitor. My laptop won’t charge and the display flickers bad until I do. Maybe it’s my Mac, monitor or the supplied unit or supplied cable. But I don’t get these problems with simpler cables.
customer_reviews.author: AndyR

customer_reviews.title: Ethernet Only works after power disconnected & reconnected
customer_reviews.text: This would be a great docking station, but both on my 2017 MacBook Pro and my Chromebook R13 the ethernet only works if I unplug the hub and plug it back in. This is originally why I bought this hub; to have a clean desk and stable connection for video conferencing calls. Now I have to reach under the desk to unplug and plug back in the docking station so the ethernet starts working.
customer_reviews.author: WilliamThrilliam

customer_reviews.title: Awesome device and smaller than it looks
customer_reviews.text: This little device works great as a rocking station for my Lenovo Yoga C630 chromebook. Network and power delivery work flawlessly. This device is also smaller than it looks so it takes up little real estate on the desktop. If you have a monitor it comes with a bracket to directly attach it to the rear visamounts for a zero footprint install.
customer_reviews.author: Jason D.

customer_reviews.title: Not working with Lenovo X1 Carbon gen 6
customer_reviews.text: In the Amazon description, it states the product is compatible with Lenovo X1 Carbon gen 6. That is not true per my test. I then searched on the Plugable website where it says Lenovo X1 Carbon gen 6 is not compatible. The Amazon description is completely incorrect. I would have thought twice before buying the product if the Amazon description was accurate.
customer_reviews.author: ric applegate

customer_reviews.title: Great product for those looking for an affordable USB C hub with lots of connectivity.
customer_reviews.text: The UD-CAM is perfect for my needs. Great set of features in a compact form factor. Just plugged it in and it all worked like a charm. GigE, HDMI for an external monitor, plenty of charging power & lots of extra USB ports all for just a little more than a replacement Apple 85W charger for my MBP15 w/Touch. I wonder why the pricing on .ca is so much higher (C$299) compared to pricing on .com (US$119 at time of purchase). UPDATE: Someone is listening as pricing on .ca is now reasonable.
customer_reviews.author: CJ

customer_reviews.title: For my 2017 Macbook Pro (No touchbar)
customer_reviews.text: Works great yet it's so small, really saves space. Allows me to plug the dock in via thunderbolt 3 to my macbook and extend my display to another monitor via HDMI (just one though, you'll need dongles if you want more monitors). Very nice packaging. I think for what this does the product could be priced more around $80-$90 but it's the thunderbolt 3 and reliable mac compatibility you're paying for (totally worth it imo considering other mac docks that charge your computer while serving as a dock with only one thunderbolt 3 wire like Caldigit's cost like $300-$400). Great dock!!
customer_reviews.author: Anon

customer_reviews.title: Great product that works as advertised, backed by great customer support
customer_reviews.text: When I originally got my dock, I had problems getting it to work with my Lenovo X1 Carbon. Plugable tech support was extremely responsive and helpful. They went above and beyond over multiple weeks to try and figure it out, even offering to take back the product beyond the original return date. Ended up being a config problem with my laptop - I had disabled the Thunderbird port for security reasons and that ended up affecting the dock.
customer_reviews.author: Brian Weeden

customer_reviews.title: Solid docking system for 1 monitor with a Mac
customer_reviews.text: If you need only one external monitor plus all the ports you had on your older Macbook before Apple took them away, this is the one. It doesn't require Displaylink, which is a plus. Big solid power supply comes with it so you don't need another $79 Apple power brick.
customer_reviews.author: Gary L. Smith

customer_reviews.title: A Great Add On
customer_reviews.text: I have been looking and have bought other brands of docks and hubs and have not been satisfied. Got this home plugged it in (Plugable) and it just worked. I have a Lenovo Yoga 730 and it worked great. It has all the connections I need and I liked that it had it's own power supply. So it needs NO power from the computer. I will say it will not charge the Lenovo 730 but I already thought that when I bought so there was not let down there. I would recommend this to anyone that needs a USB C dock. Perfect for my needs. Five Stars!
customer_reviews.author: Ron

customer_reviews.title: This no longer works with my audio interface
customer_reviews.text: I'm not sure if this overheated or if macOS update ruined this hub, but it no longer works with my audio interface, and I can no longer recommend buying this hub. Not even using ethernet or HDMI data, just 2 MIDI controllers and Scarlett 6i6
customer_reviews.author: neaumusic

customer_reviews.title: Works great with no issues!
customer_reviews.text: I really like the product, works great and I get all the ports I need. I purchase other smaller and cheaper adapters but they don't work consistently and feel cheap. This product is solid and I love that I just need to use one USB-C port on my Macbook Pro and it's ready to go. Cost more than the portable adapters but well worth it. If you want to connect to an external monitor and use all your older USB devices, this product is the way to go!
customer_reviews.author: Visual Mike

customer_reviews.title: Didn't work for my HP Elitebook 1050 G1
customer_reviews.text: Wouldn't properly install on my HP Elitebook 1050 G1. Computer kept beeping as if I had just plugged something in. 1080p monitor from HDMI kept flashing. I gave it plenty of time for drivers to install, tried a different USB-C out from laptop, restarted, tried Windows Update. Nothing worked. Will return for refund.
customer_reviews.author: Kon Peki

customer_reviews.title: I did get into contact with plugable immediately and the support was fantastic. They sent out a new and tested unit ...
customer_reviews.text: I recently bought a new HP Spectre x360 and needed a dock primarily to connect to a second screen and also for ethernet connection. I received a unit in the mail and when I plugged it into my laptop it worked for charging my PC, using ethernet, USB-A ports, and headphones. The HDMI output however did not work properly. I did get into contact with plugable immediately and the support was fantastic. They sent out a new and tested unit to me in 2 days time and it works for all features now. Maybe the fact my first unit didn't work could be a knock on their quality control, but their support makes up for it.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Monitor problems after 3.5 months
customer_reviews.text: My monitor started periodically blacking out on me after 3.5 months. The blackouts usually lasted only a few seconds, but sometimes I had to restart my laptop to get the monitor to work through this docking station. Now I've quit trying and just plug my HDMI cable directly into my laptop.
customer_reviews.author: 1point21gigawatts

customer_reviews.title: Great little dock!
customer_reviews.text: I needed something that could serve as a docking station for a notebook laptop that uses the new USB standard, and this works great! Small, simple and functional. Let's me use peripherals like two monitors, wireless mouse and keyboard and a couple of other things. Highly recommended.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: It died after one week
customer_reviews.text: I thought this was going to be exactly what I needed.... but after a week I cant even get it to charge my computer or turn on. I have tried multiple outlets checked and rechecked every connection, and nothing... I am hoping the company will reach out and replace the faulty product I received.
customer_reviews.author: Travis Dolan

customer_reviews.title: Great for Surface devices
customer_reviews.text: I got this to have a dock at my desk for the Surface GO and be flexible enough for other USB C devices. It quickly charges my devices, so far doesn't have any compatibility issues with my peripherals, and mounts to my monitor for a nice form factor.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Works great for my new Macbook Pro with only two USB C ports!
customer_reviews.text: An amazing "just plug it in and works" - eliminates all of the downsides of the MacBook Pro's "USB-C Only" by providing a single cable docking experience for your external display and Ethernet while also providing a USB 3 hub. Plugable will also offer great support if you end up needing it - but this just worked for me!
customer_reviews.author: CA Tandy

customer_reviews.title: One of best ones out there to date for the price !
customer_reviews.text: This product will provide whatever you need. I have the Dell XPS 15 (9570) and it comfortably charges my laptop without a problem. I did notice however that once in a while their will be some quirks and disconnections but nothing persistent and I have had it for 4 months or so. The three back USB ports don't carry as much V or W. Over all this product does an amazing job at connecting my razer keyboard and mouse. Allowing me to completely dock my laptop and use it as a pure desktop.
customer_reviews.author: Marco Zepeda

customer_reviews.title: USB ports unreliable
customer_reviews.text: I don't understand why I cannot charge something small and simple like an AirPods case on the front USB port. It lights up after a power cycle, but after 5 seconds the charging stops. The back USB port and a connected hard drive also regularly loose connection.
customer_reviews.author: K. M. Aye

customer_reviews.title: Ethernet port stopped working after a couple of months.
customer_reviews.text: I'm using this on a 2017 15" MacBook Pro. I've had some of the same diconnection issues others have been reporting, which annoys me, but I deal with it. What I can't deal with, however, is having to use an ADDITIONAL adapter because this dock's network port stopped working two months into me using it. I will NEVER buy another product by this company.
customer_reviews.author: Erik Blythe

customer_reviews.title: Fantastic docking station!
customer_reviews.text: Outstanding product! It works flawlessly with my HP Spectre x360 15-inch laptop. I first tried (and returned because it behaved very erratically) HP travel dock, recommended by the HP sales person. I strongly recommend the Plugable USB-C Mini Docking Station; the USB-C Power Delivery system easily recharges my laptop and all devices connected to the dock run smoothly. Equally outstanding is Plugable's customer support department. Thank you, David W., for your patience and competent advice.
customer_reviews.author: sergio

customer_reviews.title: Works as advertised
customer_reviews.text: Works great on my HP Spectre x360 (late 2017 Kaby Lake-R refresh). Laptop is holding a charge with it plugged into the docking station. Yeah, I get the suggestion to use HP branded power adapters, but it works great
customer_reviews.author: Brent A. Feathers

customer_reviews.title: Simple to use and works like a charm
customer_reviews.text: Incredibly easy to setup for my MacBook Pro. You MUST use the provided cable and you MUST plug into one of the ports that supports multiple functions, not all of the USB-c ports are multi functional.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Awesome for Chromebooks!
customer_reviews.text: Using it to dock my HP X2 Chromebook. Connects to a speaker, 2k 31" monitor, and external harddrive. All function reliably. Unit is smaller and lighter than it appears.
customer_reviews.author: Akshun J

customer_reviews.title: Great Dock
customer_reviews.text: We have purchased a few of these lately. Paired with a 1' HDMI cable and mounted to the back of a monitor, it works really well. It also has higher charging capabilities than the previous Plugable USB-C docks. It only has 1 video output but for most users, this is great.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Easy to use
customer_reviews.text: Works great. Able to plug in my MacBook Air and use it as a desktop on larger monitor if I choose. Screen quality looks sharp.
customer_reviews.author: J Gage

customer_reviews.title: Stopped functioning after ~7 months
customer_reviews.text: I have used this dock for less than a year to connect my Macbook to a single HDMI display and keyboard. It worked great for the entire time, until today the unit stopped charging and connecting the Macbook over USB-C. I tried different cables, ports, etc. all with the same result. Different USB-C docks work perfectly with the same Macbook and monitor/keyboard connected. Very disappointing for simple easy to use product.
customer_reviews.author: Taylor

customer_reviews.title: Works as advertised
customer_reviews.text: I have not tested the video capabilities, but it works fine as a charging station, hub, and wired Ethernet (MacBook Pro 2018). Good compact size. Requires a separate ethernet driver though (works fine once installed).
customer_reviews.author: Carl R.

customer_reviews.title: Yes! No more switching screens to play games
customer_reviews.text: Awesome! I can play games on my 27 monitor now. I had a Kensington docking station before, and when I would play games my 27 monitor would go blank and I would have to play on my 15” laptop screen. This dock because of the USB C connection, I can now play on my 27 monitor.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: does not work as specified.
customer_reviews.text: Does not work properly. power delivery is an issue and also all ports do not work once connected.
customer_reviews.author: kaps1972

customer_reviews.title: Exactly as Expected
customer_reviews.text: This little docking station does exactly what I expected it to. It also comes with a handy attachment kit.
customer_reviews.author: Gester

customer_reviews.title: Unstable with multiple users
customer_reviews.text: We bought a few of these to test with Lenovo Thinkpad series laptops, and with multiple users experienced jumping monitor displays and intermittent power supply. I suspect they don't work properly when plugged into a power strip (which is required for users far from an outlet) and/or they don't deliver enough power to these laptops consistently. Regardless, they don't work as intended.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: It works with HP Envy 13
customer_reviews.text: I have an all 4K video setup. I was able to just plug and go with an HP Envy 13-ad173cl (uses Intel 620 video chip with NVIDIA MX150), IOGEAR GCS1794 (HDMI switch), and an LG 27UD60 (IPS monitor). Does not supply power over USB-C to laptop.
customer_reviews.author: UsuallyHappy

customer_reviews.title: Best MacBook Accessory
customer_reviews.text: Purchased just over a year ago for my MacBook Pro (13-inch, Late 2016, Four Thunderbolt 3 Ports). It has completely erased a subtle, but constant pain point in my life. I use mine for power, display, USB, and ethernet and it all works flawlessly.
customer_reviews.author: Nathan Colgate Clark

customer_reviews.title: Great docking station. Compact, easy to set up, works perfectly.
customer_reviews.text: Works flawlessly with my XPS-13 (2016) version and a 4K monitor, audio and some USB accessories.. Nice and compact. Performance is good. Love it.
customer_reviews.author: J. Saltiel

customer_reviews.title: keeps connecting and disconnecting
customer_reviews.text: i have a x1 Carbon 6th gen, and everytime i plug the dock in, it keeps connecting and disconnecting for several time and i have to pray for it to work. it sometimes work after multiple connect disconnect fits.
customer_reviews.author: justin chao

customer_reviews.title: Best design for office use
customer_reviews.text: Perfect design for office use. USB & headphone jack in prominent position, with all other ports in rear to keep space uncluttered.
customer_reviews.author: J A

customer_reviews.title: Just what the doctor ordered
customer_reviews.text: I've tried several combinations of usb-c power supply and usb-c adaptor on my 15" usb-c MacBook pro - this product is excellent. The power brick is separate (on the floor) with just the ports that I need. Works like a charm.
customer_reviews.author: Bill

customer_reviews.title: Simple setup, easy to use.
customer_reviews.text: A nice device, nice and easy to set up and use. I’ve got a big of a lag in performance of a wireless keyboard/mouse that’s attached to it, but not sure if that can be directly related to the dock.
customer_reviews.author: Joshua White

customer_reviews.title: Fantastic...Love the mounting ability
customer_reviews.text: I bought two of these. One for work and one for home. The home one is mounted on the back of my monitor and looks fantastic and natural. Never had an issue with either of these. They work completely as expected.
customer_reviews.author: Scott Curry

customer_reviews.title: Missing C5 plug (a.k.a.  "Mickey Mouse") power cable.
customer_reviews.text: Missing C5 (a.k.a. "Mickey Mouse") plug power cable. This absolutely maddening - I had to order the cable separately to plug in the box, so I haven't been able to even test it yet. For this price, I expect to get everything needed to use this box.
customer_reviews.author: Michael J DeWeert

customer_reviews.title: Works for a Lenovo X1 Carbon 5th Gen
customer_reviews.text: Network, Video, and USB all work for the X1 5th gen running Windows 10. Amazing device!
customer_reviews.author: Doug

customer_reviews.title: Does not charge macbook or stay connected
customer_reviews.text: This item worked for about a month. Then when it was just past 30 days so I couldn't return it, it stopped charging my macbook pro 13". Then when it was plugged in, it would automatically connect and disconnect the external monitor every 10 seconds or so
customer_reviews.author: A to Z nutrition

customer_reviews.title: Stops working after a couple of weeks
customer_reviews.text: Worked initially, but all of a sudden, the ports stops working. Tried connecting my printer and my mouse to it and my MBP just stops registering any of them. Very disappointed.
customer_reviews.author: J.Wang

customer_reviews.title: Doesn't charge my computer
customer_reviews.text: I'm not sure if I missed something in the description, but it doesn't charge your computer.
customer_reviews.author: Karen Takashima

customer_reviews.title: Grate Deal!
customer_reviews.text: Excellent docking station. It is compact and doesn’t take up much space. Works great with my Surface Go.
customer_reviews.author: nineball

customer_reviews.title: Not for chuwi hibook Pro tablets
customer_reviews.text: Product does not work with chuwi hibook Pro. Only charges tablet while in use if used with a certain tablet. Will not charge most tablets.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Works well with Dell XPS-15
customer_reviews.text: Needed to change a Bios setting to eliminate nag box on power up.
customer_reviews.author: Joe Vornbrock

customer_reviews.title: STOPPED WORKING within 6 months
customer_reviews.text: I've been using this usb hub since July...has worked ok "ish"... I use a dual display at work and this unit has always had connection issues but I was able to deal with them by unplugging and plugging the usb-C cord back into my laptop. Now it just won't connect at all.
customer_reviews.author: Joel

customer_reviews.title: Not universal
customer_reviews.text: Product stated it’s universal...it’s not. Could not get to work with any laptop. I tried two usb-c and a thunderbolt with no success. Returned.
customer_reviews.author: Kevin Chafins

customer_reviews.title: Works with Debian/ Win10
customer_reviews.text: Excellent customer support. Works 100% with Debian 10 and Win10 dual boot on Dell Latitude 5490. Extremely pleased. Using for about 1 year now.
customer_reviews.author: Salvatore Facista

customer_reviews.title: Good value for a docking station that also charges your laptop via a single cable!
customer_reviews.text: Used with Lenovo X1 Carbon Gen 6 on Windows 10. Appears to be plug and play. Tested all features except for audio out - no issues identified for the first 24 hours. Charging works. Has a Realtek NIC which aren't my favourite but it has worked well so far.
customer_reviews.author: Mr Richard C Khor

customer_reviews.title: Works With Linux
customer_reviews.text: This has been the most reliable hub I've used with both Ubuntu and Pop!_OS.
customer_reviews.author: J. Stramel

customer_reviews.title: Plug and Play on Macbook Pro 15" 2018
customer_reviews.text: Amazing product that works flawlessly with my macbook pro. I have the following attached: - dc power - wireless keyboard - wireless mouse - HDMI output to a DELL Ultrawide 3440 x 1440 monitor with sound. Just plug one usb-c cable in and everything works perfectly.
customer_reviews.author: Z

customer_reviews.title: I you have problems with it - check your cable
customer_reviews.text: Works well. I had a problem with connection after one year. Sometimes connection dropped and I could hear connection sound in a cycle every 3-5 sec. Solved by replacing original thunderbolt cable to a new one.
customer_reviews.author: Yury Alexandrov

customer_reviews.title: Works Great
customer_reviews.text: I have a 2018 15" Macbook Pro, and it works awesome.
customer_reviews.author: Benjamin Burton

customer_reviews.title: I expected a lot more from Plugable
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this unit for use with a HP Spectre 360 13.3" and from the moment I connected it, it has been nothing but trouble. -The laptop warns me that I should use HP charger. - The PC keeps telling me usb device not recognized - The Charging is inconsistent and stops for no reason - I constantly receive this USB device was not recognized message not to mention that this $130 device is missing features that were included in a $50 device like - memory card reader (SD / Micro Sd) - Extra USB C - Fast Charging USB port - Display Port
customer_reviews.author: 2 Live And Buy In LA

customer_reviews.title: Fantastic product. Worked right out of the box with ...
customer_reviews.text: Fantastic product. Worked right out of the box with my Lenovo Yoga 720 no issues.
customer_reviews.author: Andrew Lucas

customer_reviews.title: Best bang for the buck
customer_reviews.text: Considering we get enough power to power my 15" MacBook pro + the USB Hub + reducing many cables to a SINGLE one...Awesome!
customer_reviews.author: Tyler S

customer_reviews.title: Small & powerful
customer_reviews.text: Very good dock - small, powerful, no problem with connection at all. I'm using every port except RJ-45. Using with mac pro 15" 2018
customer_reviews.author: Kostiantyn Beltik

customer_reviews.title: Perfect little dock station
customer_reviews.text: Perfect little dock station. Able to charge my macbook pro and also connect up ethernet, external keyboard, mouse, corded headphones, and usb2 thumbdrives. Recommended.
customer_reviews.author: GREG L TURNER

customer_reviews.title: Great product it charges my Macbook and it does not get hot.
customer_reviews.text: Great product it charges my Macbook and it does not get hot.
customer_reviews.author: Danny A

customer_reviews.title: I highly recommend it.
customer_reviews.text: I have struggled to find a reliable and consistent dock for my Macs over the years. This guy is about the size of an Apple TV and handles the task very well. I have not experienced a single glitch. I bough another for my office...I highly recommend it.
customer_reviews.author: Hunter

customer_reviews.title: they all connect and respond fine. Highly recommend
customer_reviews.text: Using with with a 5th Gen Lenovo X1 Carbon, connecting power, ethernet, 4K monitor, mouse and keyboard. Have also connected two different Macbook Pro (13'' and 15'', different gens), they all connect and respond fine. Highly recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Angel Rivera

customer_reviews.title: PERFECT
customer_reviews.text: Works perfectly with my 2017 MPB 13 inch and my HP laptop with full charging and peripheral functionality. I have been looking for a dock like this that is reasonably priced since I bought my macbook pro. Did not want to spend $300 for a juiced up dock. This is perfect. I wish it had one more monitor port for a dual screen set up, but this is more than adequate if you only have one screen.
customer_reviews.author: dbeasy

customer_reviews.title: Amazing Hub. This thing is perfect for my Lenovo ...
customer_reviews.text: Amazing Hub. This thing is perfect for my Lenovo 720 13"
customer_reviews.author: K. Grittner

customer_reviews.title: This product is worth to have it works nicely with MacBook Pro late 2016 15"
customer_reviews.text: This product is worth to have it and works nicely with MacBook Pro late 2016 15". It can be charged the MacBook Pro fast enough (required 87W power), this one supplies 100W. With 4 USB 3.0 ports and HDMI 4K makes my work flow easily . The audio port is work very nice and can be used with audio-controlled keyboard on MacBook Pro or external keyboard. Note is that if you need to use Siri, make sure you set the microphone choices correctly in System Preferences -> Siri. So far I like this product and save my cost to buy the dock and an additional power adapter.
customer_reviews.author: Paratchata

customer_reviews.title: Good solution for Macbook Pro.
customer_reviews.text: Works great for my needs. Using with a 15" Macbook Pro (late 2016), let's me dock at my desk with one cable and connect to Monitor, Lan and external drives in a snap.
customer_reviews.author: Chris Paton

customer_reviews.title: Failed HDMI port
customer_reviews.text: Unit works fine as dock except for HMDI port failed after 6 months
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: works like a champ and the vesa mount is a nice addition
customer_reviews.text: Just unpacked it and set it up. Super easy setup and works like a champ! It's way smaller than I thought and the vesa mount is a nice addition. Even fixed my issue with not being able to get clamshell mode to work on my MPB 2017. If it holds up I'll be on happy camper! MBP 2017 LG 34UM67 Logitech wireless keyboard Microsoft wireless mouse various usb hard drives
customer_reviews.author: Thomas C. Quigley

customer_reviews.title: Truly Plug-and-Play
customer_reviews.text: I honestly cannot remember the last time I've had the privilege of enjoying a product that was truly 100% plug-and-play. This docking station is beautifully small, and with every device and peripheral I added to it, everything just worked seamlessly. The laptop that this docking station is serving is a Dell XPS 13 (2018 model), and so far it has handled connecting to headphones, Ethernet, a peripheral mouse, and an Android phone simultaneously without a single touch of external configuration. Plugable, you have my loyalty. Thank you for an incredible product.
customer_reviews.author: Neill

customer_reviews.title: Works Great Audio, So-So
customer_reviews.text: Works with my Dell XPS 9500. So far so good, best dock for the money usb-c is a bonus even charges my laptop. Got rid of a USB hub and a bunch of extra cables. One cable plugs into the laptop now, it really improved my desk space. Only downside is the audio has a little bit of white noise ordered a Ground Loop Noise Isolator to solve that.
customer_reviews.author: Chris

customer_reviews.title: Too bulky and not that many ports
customer_reviews.text: Too bulky for the limited number of ports it has. The transformer (not shown here) is huge. I have another docking station with 2 to 3 times more ports (including two HDMI), which is much smaller, and has just a small transformer/plug.
customer_reviews.author: dUser

customer_reviews.title: Worked Right Away With Lenovo 920 and Dell XPS 13 both with intel 8th gen.
customer_reviews.text: Awesome Little Dock. My wife has a Lenovo 920 and I have a Dell XPS 13 this little dock worked great with both of our laptops right out of the box. Plugged in everything and then connected via USB C and everything worked as expected. The Lenovo 920 can be a little finicky with other products but this worked great.
customer_reviews.author: Parm

customer_reviews.title: Spent the extra money for a Promise Dock that better understands TB 3 which never has problems
customer_reviews.text: I get a lot of keyboard disconnects that I need to resolve by rebooting my 2017 15" MacBook Pro after the Mac sleeps. Also get messages about USB disks not being properly dismounted. Spent the extra money for a Promise Dock that better understands TB 3 which never has problems.
customer_reviews.author: Mark S

customer_reviews.title: This is a great value for the money
customer_reviews.text: Seems to be well-made and works without issues. I wish they had faster customer support, but that's what you get with a small company selling products at a competitive price. This is a great value for the money, and I'd purchase again without question.
customer_reviews.author: Thomas W. Bowen

customer_reviews.title: Great MacBook Pro Desktop Docking Station
customer_reviews.text: Bought the docking station to use with my 2016 MacBook Pro when in the office. It replaces Apple's 87W charger and a multi-port USB-C hub with Ethernet/HDMI and costs less. No issues with charging, wired networking, and using an external monitor. If you have a MacBook Pro and use it frequently at a desk, don't hesitate to get this docking station.
customer_reviews.author: Ed Chiang

customer_reviews.title: Works, PD, 4K HDMI, Ethernet, Audio, USB3.
customer_reviews.text: Happy. Works with my HP Spectre 15", 2018, 8th Gen iCore. USB-C PD works. If you can live with a single external 4K Alt-mode display and the laptop screen - then this is the unit. NO Video Drivers (DisplayLink) Needed!
customer_reviews.author: Daddio

customer_reviews.title: awesome unit for clearing up my desktop and cleanly powering ...
customer_reviews.text: awesome unit for clearing up my desktop and cleanly powering my MacBook Pro and numerous accessories. Feels and looks high-quality, gets out of the way, and functions great. Wish there was just one more USB port instead of ethernet since my house isn't wired.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: No video for Macbook Pro 13" 2017
customer_reviews.text: video out doesn't work so I can't hook up a second display. pretty worthless to me without that. Now I'm stuck with a $100 usb hub.
customer_reviews.author: soultrip

product_meta.title: Plugable USB C Dock with 85W Charging Compatible with Thunderbolt 3 and USB-C MacBooks and Select Windows Laptops (HDMI up to 4K@30Hz, Ethernet, 4X USB 3.0 Ports, USB-C PD, Includes VESA Mount)
feature_bullets: POWERFUL USB-C DOCK - Power up your productivity with a single 4K HDMI output (supports 4K 30Hz, 2560x1600 and lower at 60Hz), Ethernet, audio input/output, and four additional USB ports while providing up to 85W of power to charge your attached USB-C or Thunderbolt 3 system

SMALL-SCALE DESIGN - A sleek and minimal form factor means saving valuable desk space and avoiding a clutter of electronics and cables. Includes a VESA mount to tuck the dock behind a monitor for an even lower profile at your workstation

4K PERFORMANCE - With VESA DisplayPort Alternate Mode over USB-C (Alt Mode), the dock establishes a direct pipeline to your host graphics processor. Enjoy native-level display performances up to the host system's GPU capabilities

COMPATIBILITY - Requires compatible USB-C port supporting both video and charging or Thunderbolt 3 system (Surface Pro 7, Surface Laptop 3, HP Spectre, Dell XPS). Not compatible with legacy USB 3.0 systems. Not all USB-C ports and systems support Power Delivery or Alt Mode; please see our website for compatibility tables. DisplayPort monitors are not supported
2 YEAR WARRANTY - We love our Plugable products, and hope you will too. All of our products are backed with a 24 month limited parts and labor warranty as well as Seattle-based email support
